actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide for an increase in benefits computed under the special minimum formula to coincide with the 1975 and 1976 cost-of-living increases in benefits computed under the regular formula.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends Title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to increase from $9.00 to $10.50 the amount to be used in determining the minimum primary insurance amount to which an individual shall be entitled. Directs that the increase shall coincide with the 1975 and 1976 cost-of-living in benefits computed under the regular formula.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide for an increase in benefits computed under the special minimum formula to coincide with the 1975 and 1976 cost-of-living increases in benefits computed under the regular formula.
